description: Users may experience unexpected behavior indicating potential unauthorized access resulting from the Windows Common Log File System Driver elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-43501). The affected systems include various builds of Windows 10 and 11, specifically builds 10.0.26100.2033, 10.0.22631.4317, 10.0.22621.4317, and 10.0.22000.3260. Administrators may notice changes in file access permissions or unexpected system-level modifications which could result from this vulnerability. End users might report unusual application behavior when attempting to perform file operations that were previously restricted, potentially affecting sensitive data integrity. The relevant KB Articles addressing these issues include KB-5044285, KB-5044284, KB-5044280, and KB-5044273.
